com.vmware.vapi.internal

Class VersionUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmware.vapi.internal.VersionUtil

  • public class VersionUtil
extends Object
    Utility for accessing vAPI version information at runtime.

    This util loads couple of classpath resources with version information

    • vapi_runtime_version.properties - provided by the runtime itself
    • vapi_sdk_version.properties - may be provided by consumers of the vAPI runtime, e.g. an SDK or dynamic vAPI client built on top of it
    Each of these resource must be a properties file with version information about particular layer/component of the software stack (like runtime or SDK). It must contain the following keys:
    • component.name - name of the component (e.g. "vAPI" for the runtime)
    • component.version - version (e.g. "2.7.1")
    • component.build - build number
    The values of for these keys must be ASCII characters only, and should not contain whitespace characters.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getUserAgent

        public static String getUserAgent()
        Returns a String representing the user agent.

        The user agent string is built based on the version resources loaded by this class. Examples:

        • vAPI/2.7.1 Java/1.8.0_73 (Windows 10; 10.0; amd64)
        • vAPI/2.7.1 Java/1.7.0_76 (Linux; 2.6.32-642.6.2.el6.x86_64; amd64)
        • SDK/6.6.2 vAPI/2.7.1 Java/1.8.0_73 (Windows 10; 10.0; amd64)
        • vRO/7.2.0 vAPI/2.7.1 Java/1.8.0_73 (Windows 10; 10.0; amd64)
        Returns:
        the user agent string
